Posts.Content: sandie57 wrote: I had breast cancer 12 years ago and had a routine mammogram recently. I am worried since the mammogram report was incomplete.  The BI-RADS is 0. Has anyone else had these comments on their mammogram report?   "There are scattered fibroglandular elements in both breasts that could obscure a lesion on mammography. Right post surgical scar appears more contracted. There is a calcification on a post surgical scar. No significant masses or calcifications are seen in either breast. Clinical correlation and if warrented breast MRI may be of help to rule out recurrent cancer. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Understanding Mammogram Report sandie57 Dukemom2

Posts.Content: sandie57 wrote: My mother was diagnosed with breast cancer when she was 45 years old. She is now 57 years old. She has on the side of her breasts; something that looks like spider bites. She has around 5. She also said the other day she had some pain on her breast but it now it is gone. She has had those spider bites pimples for months. Does anyone know what this could be? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Pimples? sandie57 san4850
